channel.title: Project Power Down (please look *important)
channel.description:
The Project power down:
first of all its an option and i hope everyone participates in this. what this basically is that we will set a day and time,[b]June 25th 2008 at 8pm-9pm (EST)[/b]. between 8 and 9 i would like all of you to turn off your computer ( thus no one will be on moparisthebest) just for that one hour, and do something else ( don't go and watch the t.v). just go outside and do something or take a long walk. by doing this we can all contribute to our globe and our health. i hope everyone joins this and it be great if mopar registers how many people log in on that time, hope the # is 0. thank you very much. *Remember [b]the Earth is our only home[/b], let us not destroy it.
please sign up (if you would like to participate [u][b]please copy "the list of participation" then add your name in it and re post it thank you.[/b][/u]
[b][size=10pt][size=10pt]If you want to participate post here or else do not bother your are only wasting your time.[/size][/size][/b]
http://www.timezoneconverter.com/cgi-bin/tzc.tzc
the list of participation: seto Sppt Lanthus20 bowserjr2

item.title: Project Power Down (please look *important)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

On another topic

We don’t pollute anywhere near as much as we used to like when they had the polluting factories

“when” they had the “polluting factories”?

Do you go outside at all? The vast majority of power stations in the UK are fuel-burning - ie, they have very big chimneys. The only reason you don’t see factories around like that so much anymore is because we sell all our manufacturing to China and shit, not because burning fossil fuels is some relic of the past…

Read full topic

[/quote]
Global warming causes colder winters and will soon cause the earth to either melt or freeze over. Maybe it is a load of BS but i wouldn’t take any chances.[/quote]

There talking about damage maybe 50 years from now “OH NOES MY CHILDRENS CHILDREN”. Until then warmer clothes will be made. And hot summers melts ice caps, and by time winter comes the will freeze up again if it supposedly becoming colder.

item.title: Project Power Down (please look *important)
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Also do you even know what they do with the stuff you throw in the recycling bins?

Well nearly all of it gets put into a hole in the ground, that’s right - exactly what they do to all rubbish, except with the stuff from the recycling bins they put certain stuff into a certain hole. So one hole is for plastic bottles, another for paper etc etc etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Power Down (please look *important)

item.description:

[quote=“Mopman, post:35, topic:215083”][quote author=magma828 link=topic=282744.msg2296263#msg2296263 date=1214419332]
I save the earth by cycling to school and putting the fridge outside to stop global warming.
[/quote]

Fridge outside == works harder == more energy used == more fossil fuel burned == moar global warming

oh noes!!![/quote]
Just build a windmill to power it.
Fridge outside == work harder == more energy used == less energy to other thing.

item.title: Project Power Down (please look *important)
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:215201”][quote author=jme link=topic=282744.msg2296234#msg2296234 date=1214417566]

think about this if in the north the ice bergs are melting, whats going to happen near the equator.
the effects of globel warming are faster that you think and we will see the full effect in our life time.

Turning off my computer for an hour isn’t going to save us from global warming.

It’s a natural cycle, and honestly I just couldn’t give a shit. I got my own problems to worry about, I’m not going to fret about little billy 200 years from now.
[/quote]

I think quite a few 10 year olds think they’re smart and go through a phase of “saving the planet”.

I remember I had a friend who said I need to stop using my computer because in a few years a tsunami could come and I would need to be fit and healthy to run away.[/quote]

They also in a few years florida will be underwater and california will be somewhere in the pacific… Well that said that it would happen around here like 50 years ago when my parents were kids. Nothing has happened.

Read full topic
